app_code_name.description: The app's code name. This will be used as the app's id for APIS

app_features.description: A list of the app's features. Will be displayed to the user in the app info page. Max 10 features. Max feature length is 500 chars.

app_mobile_screenshot_uris.description: Links to app screenshots or demo videos. Displayed on the mobile App info page. Each asset must be 608 × 272 px. Supported formats: GIF, PNG, JPEG, MJPEG, SVG, MP4, WebM, OVG.

app_screenshot_uris.description: Links to app screenshots or demo videos. Displayed on the desktop App info page. Each asset must be 608 × 272 px. Supported formats: GIF, PNG, JPEG, MJPEG, SVG, MP4, WebM, OVG.

app_type.description: The app's type. Valid values are: payments, wallets, communication, menu_items, docuforms, import_clients, automated_flows, signatures, onboarding_wizard, notifications

contact_support_link.description: Link to the app's contact support page

deep_link.description: The deep link to an inner product page. This is not made for third-party apps, but for apps that open as part of the product. Made for internal developer use only.

path.description: The relative path to the page.

path_params.description: The params that will be added to the path URL (optional)

demand_scopes.description: Scopes the application must have in order to serve requests.

short_description.description: The app's short description. Should contain a summarize review of the app's purpose and functions. Max length is 260 chars.

text.description: The app's long description. Should describe the app's functions in detail. Max length is 380 chars.

menu_items.description: Configuration for the left sidebar menu

category.description: Section of the left menu in which the item will appear. Valid values are: ["calendar", "clients", "payments", "inbox", "documents", "campaigns", "reputation", "my-livesite", "social", "social_info", "app_market", "reports", "team-chat", "advertising", "subscriptions", "my_account", "cashflow", "workforce", "setupguide", "reviews", "social_media", "online_listing"]

permissions.description: Permissions to control who can view this menu item. Available permissions: ["can_access_listings_management", "can_access_soci", "can_access_online_presence", "can_access_clients", "can_use_reports", "can_view_payments", "can_view_documents", "has_marketing_permissions", "can_access_admin_account", "can_access_settings", "can_export_payments"]

route.description: Suffix route relative to the app domain.

name.description: The app's name. Must be 3 to 25 chars long.

open_in_new_tab.description: Whether the app will be opened in a new tab or as an iframe

payment_data.description: Payment data for the app. Will be displayed in the app info page

pay_per_unit.description: The units available in this purchasable for extra payment

currency.description: Currency, allowed only: USD, GBP or EUR

personal_connection.description: Whether the app requires each user to connect separately

privacy_policy_link.description: A link to the apps privacy policy

redirect_uri.description: The link that the user will be redirected to when opening the app

scopes.description: Scopes the application needs access to.

supported_countries.description: Countries in which the app will be available. Empty array for all countries.

trusted.description: Whether application can skip the authorization screen (true/false)

url_params.description: Parameters that will be passed to the app. Valid values are: impersonate, business_uid, staff_role, staff_uid, payment_permissions, language, package, brand_host

get.description: Returns an app its by code name, if it is associated with the token's directory

post.description: Assign an application to business or directory so that it can be viewed in the App Market

built_in.description: Define the app as built_in for this directory, meaning it is installed for all its users and cannot be uninstalled by them. Used with directory_uid only.

business_uid.description: The business uid to associate the app to.

directory_uid.description: The directory uid to associate the app to.

is_internal.description: Specify that the app is an internal - used with directory_uid only.

pre_installed.description: Define the app as pre-installed for all new accounts of this directory - used with directory_uid only.

directory_uid.description: The directory uid to associate the app to.

get.description: Search for a business by external_reference_id or email. A filter is required for the API to return a result.

parameters.description: Filter by "external_id" specified. **Deprecate**. This will still work, but for new implementation please use external_reference_id.
parameters.name: external_id

country_name.description: Business’s Country. Must be a valid country name

display_name.description: Owner’s display name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines (if not provided, FIRST NAME + LAST NAME will be used)

email.description: Owner’s email, also used as the business’s main email

first_name.description: Owner’s first name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

language.description: One of en,es,fr,it,pt,de,pl,nl,en-GB. Default determined by Directory

last_name.description: Owner’s last name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

phone.description: Business phone number. Up to 20 characters

address.description: Business address. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

business_category.description: The business main occupation. Must be a valid business category

business_maturity_in_years.description: Business maturity in years. Valid value is one of [null, 0, 0.5, 0.5-2, 2+]

hide_address.description: Whether to show the business address to clients

landing_page.description: Deprecated - Previously used for marketing purposes, up to 255 characters

logo_url.description: Business logo URL - A valid image URL. Supporting formats: jpg, jpeg, gif, png, SVG. Make sure the URL includes one of these extensions

name.description: Business name. Up to 100 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

short_description.description: Short description of the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

time_zone.description: Time zone name from MAPPING object found in: https://api.rubyonrails.org/v4.2.3/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html, Default value is determined by the Directory

website_url.description: Business’s website URL. Must be a valid URL address including http/https.

google_client_id.description: Google Analytics ID to be embedded in the client portal, helping businesses to track their clients using Google Analytics. Must be a valid ID from Google

mixpanel_id.description: Mixpanel ID for mixpanel integration (up to 80 characters). Matching pattern tracking of business actions

audit.description: For internal tracking of business actions. Format: [{'action' => 'action_name','context' => {'key' => 'value'}}]

external_id.description: Legacy, replaced by external_reference_id. It may also be referred to as a 'nickname'. Must contain at least one lowercase letter, can include numbers, and dots, at least 5 characters long, platform unique

external_reference_id.description: Unique id that represents the business in the partner’s systems

identities.description: Array of valid identity uids. Identities represent different occupational verticals. To obtain a full list of identities, please contact support

in_setup.description: Whether the business is in setup mode

intents.description: List of modules the business wishes to use in the product from this list: ["accept_payments_tile", "documents_and_forms", "add_online_scheduling", "secure_portal_for_clients", "promotions", "manage_client_records"]

invite.description: Reference id to the marketing channel

is_template.description: Whether this account can be used as a template for creating more businesses

note.description: An administrative note about the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

suggested_identities.description: List of suggested identities to tailor the business experience

tags.description: A list of comma-separated tags. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

template_business_id.description: Configure the newly created business similar to the provided business id

get.description: Validates username/password credentials for login. The API will be blocked for the username after 5 failed attempts.

unique_validation_identifier.description: The future business' unique validation identifier

display_name.description: Owner’s display name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines (if not provided, FIRST NAME + LAST NAME will be used)

first_name.description: Owner’s first name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

last_name.description: Owner’s last name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

logo_url.description: Business logo URL - A valid image URL. Supporting formats: jpg, jpeg, gif, png, SVG. Make sure the URL includes one of these extensions

name.description: Business name. Up to 100 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

phone.description: Business phone number. Up to 20 characters

scheduling_disabled.description: Business is not offering online scheduling through client portal

short_description.description: Short description of the business. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

time_zone.description: Time zone name from MAPPING object found in: https://api.rubyonrails.org/v4.2.3/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html . Default value is determined by the Directory

website_url.description: Business’s website URL. Must be a valid URL address including http/https.

external_id.description: Legacy, replaced by external_reference_id. It may also be referred to as a 'nickname'. Must contain at least one lowercase letter, can include numbers, and dots, at least 5 characters long, platform unique

allow_online_payment.description: true, false, default: true if the business is connected to payment provider

due_date.description: invoice due ,must be later than issued_at

rate.description: invoice item tax rate in percentages

parameters.description: A unique identifer of the business. Can be the Business UID or nickname\external ID
parameters.name: X-On-Behalf-Of

business_id.description: A unique identifier of the business. Can be the Business UID or nickname\external ID.

email.description: Lead email address. Unique per business.

first_name.description: Lead first name. Mandatory for a new lead.

identifier_type.description: Defines which unique identifier will be used to search for an existing lead or create a new one. Possible values: "email" or "unique_id"

message_data.description: Key and value that will appear in message

notifications.description: A list of notifications to send after processing of the lead. Possible values: "auto-reply" (thank you email to the end user), "email" (notify the business owner) or "sms" (text notification to the business owner). None if empty.

opt_in.description: Send "true" if lead opted in for promotions. Make sure the "opt-in" client card field is added to the client card under Settings>Client card.

opt_in_transactional_sms.description: Whether the client opts in to receive transactional SMS messages.

request_data.description: Key and value properties that will update new lead and appear in message

request_title.description: Request title. Will also be the created conversation title.

source.description: Will be displayed to the business owner as the lead source

source_url.description: The URL of the page where the lead was created.

status.description: Use a client status to categorize clients according to their relationship with your business, default is Lead.

system_message.description: A message displayed to the business owner to introduce the lead. May contain links.

tags.description: Customized labels that enbale you to sort your data using personalized words, phrases or themes that are meaningful to you and your business

unique_id.description: Lead unique id. Unique per business.

channels.description: Comma separated list of channels. Valid values: sms,email. By default will send to all.

conversation_uid.description: Use conversation_uid for adding a message to an existing conversation, do not pass this param for creating new conversation

post.description: Assign Dedicated Number For Account, This API requires the 'enable_dedicated_nexmo_number' feature flag to be enabled on your account/directory. For additional information please reach out to our support.

customer_id.description: The customer ID at the payment gateway

default.description: true/false. default: false (will be set to true if it is the client's first card)

put.description: Update a checkout process from webhook

amount.description: The charged amount  (You should send this only if you are in sync_flow)

card.description: The saved card info - (You should send this only if client want to save the card)

card_id.description: The card id - should be unique value

customer_id.description: The customer unique id (You should send this only if client want to save the card)

fees.description: Array of fees (Max 1 fee) (Relevant only for when sync_flow is not true)

payment_method.description: The payment method which was used in checkout. Available methods: 'Credit Card', 'Bank Payment - ACH'.

ps_id.description: The payment status uid (You should send this only if you are in sync_flow)

state.description: The current payment state. This field can be used only for creating a pending payment. Value can be only 'pending'

sync_flow.description: You should send true in case it is a post checkout flow

tips.description: Array of tips (Max 1 tip) (Relevant only for when sync_flow is not true)

transaction_id.description: The external payment gateway transaction id

get.summary: Get Open Checkout For Specific url_key

valid_from.description: First valid date of the client package (ISO 8601 format)

valid_until.description: Last valid date of the client package (ISO 8601 format). Default: will be set according to package expiration.

matter_uid.description: Matter/Conversation UID. If not provided, the system will attempt to find the default matter for the client.

discount_unit.description: Package discount unit [F-Fixed, P-Percentage] (Only for view purposes)

expiration.description: Once package is instanced for a client, it will be valid for expiration number X expiration unit

expiration_unit.description: The expiration unit (M-Month, D-Day, W-Week, Y-Year)

total_bookings.description: Usage number allowed for specific item within the package

products.description: Products included in the package. Up to 3 different products allowed.

quantity.description: Product's quantity, must be greater than 0, up to 5 items allowed.

mark_as_online.description: Enable online refund. Default is disabled

payment_subject_id.description: The ID of the entity for which the payment has been made

payment_subject_type.description: The type of entity for which the payment has been made. Available types: 'Meeting', 'EventAttendance', 'Invoice', 'ClientBookingPackage', 'ProductOrder'.

staff_id.description: Default is set to the staff that performed the API call. Business owner is allowed to send staff_id

matter_uid.description: The matter uid of the relevant payment

payment_status_uid.description: The uid of the relevant payment request to match

parameters.description: How many items to return per page. Default: 25. Max: 100
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Maximum number of records which are returned for the request
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: First record's index in the returned list (e.g. per_page = 10, offset = 1, reords 11 to 20 are returned)
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: If equals to true, returns records from the past only. Otherwise, returns future bookings as well.
parameters.name: passed

parameters.description: Relevant to recurring appointment/event, returns appointment/event attendance which their start_time is bigger than this parameter
parameters.name: start_time

parameters.description: Relevant to recurring appointment/event, returns appointment/event attendance which their start_time is smaller than this parameter
parameters.name: end_time

event_instance_id.description: Event instance uid. Required for event.

form_data.description: When specifying a service location as either "Client will set the address at booking" or "you will call the client," it is required to include the form_data with meeting_interaction_details inside meeting_details

time_zone.description: Default is set to UTC if not provided

event_instance_id.description: Event instance uid. Required for event.

parameters.description: New RSVP State. 'confirmed' is the only valid option. any other state is forbidden (return 403)
parameters.name: new_rsvp_state

parameters.description: The id of the event instance
parameters.name: event_instance_id

parameters.description: Filter only active services or all
parameters.name: only_active_services

parameters.description: Filter only active services or all
parameters.name: only_active_services

event_instance_id.description: Event instance uid. Required for event.

event_instance_uid.description: Event instance uid. Required for event.

parameters.description: Return only services that have events with future instances
parameters.name: has_future_instance

parameters.description: Return only services which at least one of the staff of the service is active
parameters.name: active_staff_only

parameters.description: Adding the following fields to response: min_hours_before_meeting , future_bookings_limit, remind_before_in_hours_1, remind_before_in_hours_2, meeting_reminder_sms_1, sms_booking_confirmation, meeting_reminder_sms_2, auto_follow_up_hours, default_staff, order, rwg_eligible, padding, interval
parameters.name: extra_decorator_fields

parameters.description: Return only services containing the provided search_string in their name. Usage: name[contains]=search_string
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Return only services with the provided charge_type. Usage: charge_type[in]=free,no_price
parameters.name: charge_type

parameters.description: Order services by name. Usage: order_by=name
parameters.name: order_by

parameters.description: How many items to return per page. Default: 25. Max: 100
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: End date YYYY-MM-DD format. Must be greater than the start_date by no more than 31 days
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Include DST - When this parameter set to true the response will calculate availability times including dst offset
parameters.name: include_dst

parameters.description: Adding the following fields to response: min_hours_before_meeting , future_bookings_limit, remind_before_in_hours_1, remind_before_in_hours_2, meeting_reminder_sms_1, sms_booking_confirmation, meeting_reminder_sms_2, auto_follow_up_hours, default_staff, order, rwg_eligible, padding, interval
parameters.name: extra_decorator_fields

parameters.description: End date YYYY-MM-DD format. Must be greater than the start_date by no more than 31 days
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Include DST - When this parameter set to true the response will calculate availability times including dst offset
parameters.name: include_dst

parameters.description:
Staff ids array[]. 
 In case of more than one id, query in URL will appear as: 
 staff_ids_array[]=ID1&staff_ids_array[]=ID2
parameters.name: staff_ids_array[]

app_id.description: A unique identifier for a 3rd party application.

business_id.description: A unique identifier for a business.

directory_id.description: A unique identifier for a partner.

event.description: Object / Event name to subscribe to (e.g. client, appointment)

target_url.description: Where to send the webhook response to (e.g. https://my.domain.com/path/of/webhook/call)

event.description: Object / Event name to unsubscribe from

parameters.description:
Filtering the list of webhooks.
Filter is a 'deepObject' works with:
  1. 'entity' - object which listen to event (example: client)
  2. 'event_type' - type of event to triger hoom (example: created)

Example:
  <url>?filter[entity]=client&filter[event_type]=created
parameters.name: filter
